summary: This document is a response to a grand jury subpoena in the case against Ghislaine Maxwell, listing non-confidential materials produced. It includes an index of deposition transcripts for Jeffrey Epstein and other witnesses, jail visitor logs, flight logs, police reports, and extensive audio/video interview files from the state case against Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure in the case; his deposition transcripts, jail visitor logs, flight logs, and extensive interview files are listed as produced materials.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The case is styled 'v. Maxwell'; the subpoena response is for her criminal case.

persons.name: Alfredo Rodriguez
persons.context: Deposition transcripts from July 29, 2009 and August 7, 2009 are listed among the materials produced.

persons.name: Juan Alessi
persons.context: Deposition transcripts from September 8, 2009 (Volumes I and II) are listed among the materials produced.

persons.name: Michael Reiter
persons.context: Deposition transcripts from November 23, 2009 (Volumes I and II) are listed among the materials produced.

persons.name: Janusz Banasiak
persons.context: A deposition transcript from February 16, 2010 is listed among the materials produced.

connections.description: The subpoena response is for the criminal case against Maxwell, indicating she is a co-defendant or associate in matters related to Epstein.
Rodriguez's deposition transcripts are produced in response to the Epstein cases, suggesting he was a staff member or associate.
Alessi's deposition transcripts are produced in response to the Epstein cases, suggesting he was a staff member or associate.
Reiter, likely a law enforcement officer, gave depositions related to the Epstein cases, indicating an investigative connection.

keyFacts: The document is a response to a grand jury subpoena in the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell (15 Civ. 7433).
It lists extensive evidentiary materials produced, including multiple deposition transcripts for Epstein and key witnesses (Rodriguez, Alessi, Reiter, Banasiak).
Produced materials include Jeffrey Epstein's jail visitor logs and aircraft flight logs, which are critical for tracking associations and movements.
A large volume of audio and video interview files from the state case against Epstein (labeled 'State Files 7') were produced, spanning 24 parts.
The response includes a Miami Beach Police Report, indicating local law enforcement involvement in the investigation.
